SOMETIMES JOINING TWO VERBS WITH SAME SUBJECT) -(u)h (enclitic particle - i.e. joined to end of the second verb, or its prefix if there is one. (ADV. back) ibuks (adj.) - "THEY WENT BACK" galithun ibukai; "let him not TURN BACK" ni gawandjai sik ibukana; (ADV. again, back) aftra (adv.); LIT.: "GO BACK, GIVE BACK, (re)turn" + FIG.: "repent/reform oneself, go back to some practise or habit, cause to turn/repent" ga-wandjan, wv. 1.; "HOLD BACK, refrain" ga-haban sik, wv. 3. - "from" af +dat.; "TAKE BACK" aftra niman; "go back" aftra galeithan; "CALL/SHOUT BACK" aftra hropjan, wv. 1.; "he didn't ANSWER BACK to anything he said" ni andhof im withra ainhun waurde.

(adj.) (bad, evil, unwell) ubils; (ill) siuks; "feel ill" ubil/ubilaba haban, wv. 3.; (unpleasant, repulsive) anda-sets (i-stem); (terrible, bitter, sour) •aifrs; (bitter) baitrs; (sharp, severe) *hwass; (malicious) •bauseis; (wicked, unkind) un-sels; (cruel, barbaric) un-mana-riggws; (perverse, unjust) in-winds; (evil-doing) ubil-tojis; (guilty, reprehensible) *fairina, w.adj., *ga-fairinoths, *wahs; (disgraceful) agls; (shameful) *aiwisks; (notorious) ga-tarhiths; (tarnished, stained) ga-wamms; (corrupt, biased, given to favouritism) *wilja-halths; (corrupt, sinful) fra-waurhts; (wrong, unjust) *un-raihts; (harmful, unjust) skathuls; "make bad, corrupt, spoil" fra-wairthan, sv. III, fra-wardjan, wv. 1.; "be bad/wrong, inadmissable" ni skuld wisan, irreg.; "it is bad/wrong to" ni skuld ist (+inf.).

(n.) (harm, injury) skathis, sn.; (wrong-doing) fra-waurhts, missa-deths, sf. (gen. missa-dedais); (perversity) in-winditha, sf.; (injustice, wrongness) *un-raihtei, wf.; (evil) un-thiuth, sn.; thata ubil, sn., thata ubilo, wn.; (wickedness) un-selei, wf.
ubilaba; "treat badly" aiwiskon, ga-aiwiskon, wv. 2.; "speak badly of" ubil-waurdjan, wv. 1.; "go badly, go awry" fra-rinnan, sv. III.
(n.) "a bailing out, paying of ransom" us-luneins, sf.
(v.) "bail out" (TRANS. pay fine/ransom for, redeem) *us-lunjan, wv. 1.; (INTR. evacuate, jump ship to evade wreck) us-farthon gataujan us skipa.
hansa, sf.; (of soldiers) •skara, sf., *drauhts, sf.; (cord, line, string) •rigilo, wf.; (bond) bandi, sf.
(n.) (shore, landing-place) staths, sm. (gen. stathis); "one the bank/shore" ana statha; (steep bank/slope, cliff) driuso, wf.
(usury, loaning money at interest) wokrs, sm.
(v.) (dine together, party, celebrate) bi-wisan, sv. V.
(lacking fruit) akrana-laus; (deserted, waste, sterile) auths (?i-stem, gen. authis); (of ground) •galtheis; (childless) un-barnahs; "barren woman" stairo, wf.
stoma, wm., *grundus, sm.; (of wall) grundu-waddjus, sm. & sf.
(wicker) tainjo, wf.; (large) spyreida, wm.; (wicker/mesh basket, net) snorjo, wf.; •sahrja, wm.
(n.) (the flying mammal) •mustriggs, sm.; (staff, stick) hrugga, sf., wandus, sm., triu, sn., •stika, wm.
thwahan, sv. VI.; (bathe, baptise) daupjan, wv. 1.

(n.) (armed confrontation in war) #badwa, #gunthi, #hathus, #hildi sf.; (war) wigan, ?sn. (?sm. wigans), *weig, sn.; (strife, fighting, violence) haifsts, sf.; (struggle, strife) brakja, sf., sakjo, waihjo, wf.; (dispute, fight, prize-fight) jiuka, sf.; (the slain, slaughter) #wals, sn.
(v.) haifstjan, wv. 1., weihan, sv. I.; (break, fight, quarrel) brikan, sv. IV.; (struggle, contend/quarrel with) jiukan, wv. 3.; (quarrel, argue) sakan, ga-sakan, sv. VI. - "with" +dat.
(cup, glass) stikls, sm.; "a cup of cold water" stikls kaldis watins.

(v.) (carry) bairan, sv. IV.; (bear as child) ga-bairan, sv. IV. - "will bear you a son" gabairid sunu thus; "carry through" (lit.) thairh-bairan, sv. IV.; (endure, experience) ga-beidan, wv. 1.; (cope with) fra-bairan, sv. IV.; "struggle through" thairh-arbaidjan, wv. 1.; (suffer, tolerate) thulan, ga-thulan, us-thulan, wv. 3.; (BIBLICAL ENGLISH) "bear up" (=physically lift/carry) uf-haban, wv. 3.; "to be displeased with, unable to bear, refuse" un-werjan, wv. 1.; "unable to bear it any longer" ju ni usthulandans thanamais.
•bairils, sm.; (porter, door-keeper) daura-wards, sm., daura-wardo, wf.; "cup-bearer" #skankja, wm.
un-biari, sn.; (wild animal) dius, sn.  (gen. diuzis).

bliggwan, (severely) us-bliggwan, sv. III.; (beat, strike) •biutan, sv. II.; (hit) slahan, sv. VI.; (slap) kaupatjan, wv. 1. - kaupasta, kaupatiths; "beat upon, crash against" waltjan, wv. 1.; "slam/crash" bi-stigqan, sv. III. - "against" bi +dat.; (defeat, abolish, deprive of power) blauthjan, wv. 1.

unte, du thamma ei, duthe ei, in thiz-ei; (for, as, since, you see) auk, allis, raihtis (These are typically placed after the first word of the sentence, with 'auk' taking precidence over the others if they are used with other meanings); (SEEING AS, since, given that) thande; "BECAUSE OF" in gen. - "because of that/this/which" in this, duthe, duth-the; "not because..." ana thammei ni; ni the-ei.
wairthan, sv. III., du-ginnan wairthan, (Both sv. III.); "that sorrow of yours will become/turn into joy" so saurga izwara du fahedai wairthith.
(adj.) (fitting, suitable) ga-dofs (i-stem, gen. ga-dobis); "it is fitting" ga-qimith.
boka, sf. (Attested meaning 'letter', but also means beech in other Germanic languages, cf. Russian buk 'beech', bukva 'letter', maybe from Gothic); •boka-bagms, sm.
(suit) ga-timan, sv. IV. +dat.; (come together, be fitting) ga-qiman, sv. IV.

(CJ. temporal) faurthiz-ei (+subjunctive); (ADV. temporal) faurthis, faura; (PREP. for, in front of, before/ago, along, regarding) faur +acc.; (PREP. before, in front of) faura +dat.; "the day before the sabbath" faura-sabbato, indec.; (earlier) airis; "in the presence of" in andwairthja (+gen.); (ADJ.) (former, first) fruma; (previous, last) fairna; "go before, preceed" faur-rinnan, sv. III., faur-sniwan, sv. V.; "we will not go before those who fall asleep" ni bisnewum faur thans anaslepandans; (precede, overtake) faur-bi-gaggan, sv. VII. - faur-iddja, faur-gaggans.
(adv.) faurthis; "to tell beforehand, foretell" faura-ga-teihan, sv. I.
bi-sauljan, wv. 1.; (sully oneself, become sullied) bi-saulnan, wv. 4.

(e.g. as a beggar) aihtron, wv. 2.; (ask, pray) bidjan, sv. V. (acc. of person asked, gen. of thing asked for); "beg s-one to" bidjan hwana ei (+subjunctive); (implore) us-daudo bidjan, sv. V., bidai ana-haitan, sv, VII.; (implore, adjure) bi-swaran, sv. VI.
(conceive, procreate, plant, form) us-satjan, wv. 1.; "beget children" barna ussatjan; (conceive) ga-niman in kilthein, sv. IV., in-kiltho wairthan, sv. III.
ana-stodjan, du-stodjan, wv. 1, du-ginnan, sv. III.; "you shall sorrow/begin to be sorrowful" jus saurgandans wairthith; "to begin with, at first" frumist.
frums, sm., frumisti, sn., ana-stodeins, sf.; "from the beginning" fram frumistja, us frumistja; "from the first" fram frumistin; "in the beginning, first" frumist.
(deceive) us-luton, wv. 2.; (mislead) airzjan, af-airzjan, wv. 1.; (bewitch, bewilder) af-hugjan, wv. 1.; (entertain, amuse) uf-hlohjan, wv. 1.
(formed, put together) us-satiths; (conceived) in kilthein ga-numans; "only begotten son" aina-baur, sm. (i-stem).
"on behalf of, for the sake of" fram +dat.

(BEING BEHIND) afta; "FROM BEHIND" aftana, aftaro, hindana gen.; "coming from behind she touched the hem of his garment" atgaggandei du aftaro attaitok skaut wastjos is; "go behind" hindar-leithan, sv. I.; (BEYOND, behind, over, among) hindar +acc. or +dat.; (beyond, yon side of, on that side of) hindana gen.; "LEAVE BEHIND" bi-leithan, sv. I.; bi-laibjan, wv. 1.; "STAY BEHIND, remain, be left over" bi-leiban, sv. I., af-lifnan, wv. 4.
(v.) (look at) saihwan, ga-saihwan, in-saihwan, sv. V.; (perceive) gaumjan, wv. 1. +dat.; "behold!" sai, tharuh, thanuh.
(suit, be suitable for) ga-timan, sv. IV. +dat.; (come together, be fitting) ga-qiman, sv. IV.
(creature) ga-skafts, sf.; (existence, nature) wists, sf.; (one's very being, soul, life) saiwala, sf.
(belief, faith) ga-laubeins, sf.; (opinion) ragin, sn., doms, sm.; (surmise) ana-minds, sf.; "unanimity of belief" aina-munditha, sf.; "unanimous in belief" aina-munds.

(have faith, believe, believe in) ga-laubjan, wv. 1. (dat. of person, acc. of thing); "believe in" galaubjan du +dat.; "believe that I am" galaubeith thatei ik im; (think/believe an idea) munan, pp. - man, munum, munda; (expect, suppose) ga-wenjan, wv. 1.; (imagine, suppose) ahjan, wv. 1.; (consider, regard) domjan, rahnjan, ga-rahnjan, wv. 1.; "believe to be superior" faura-rahnjan, wv. 1.
wamba, sf., suqn, sn., •buks, sm., •mauko, wf.
(loved, dear) walisa, w.adj., liufs (gen. liubis), •druths (gen. •drudis); "dear to" liufs +dat.; "beloved person, sweetheart" *hultha, wm., *hultho, wf.
(DIRECTION) uf +acc.; (POSITION) uf +dat., undar +dat.; "which is beneath" undaro +dat. - "the dust beneath your feet" mulda tho undaro fotum izwaraim.
•bagks, ?sm. (i-stem) (cf. ON bekkr, m.; OE benc, f., NHG Bank, f.; MnE bank, banquet < It banco, m.).
(v.) biugan, ga-biugan, sv. II.; "bend/bow down, lower oneself" hneiwan, sv, I.
(n.) waila-deths, sf. (gen. waila-dedais); (use, worth, profit) #bata, wm.
(v.) (derive benefit) ga-batnan, wv. 4.; (be of benefit) botjan, wv. 1., dugan, pp. - daug, dugum, dauhta.
bidjan, bidjan us-daudo, sv. V. (acc. of person asked, gen. of thing desired), bi-swaran, sv. VI.

(oppress as troubles) ana-praggan, sv. VII.; (burden, oppress) kaurjan, wv. 1.; (burden, weigh down with) af-hlathan, sv. VI.; (torment) balwjan, wv. 1. +dat.; (surround, besiege) bi-satjan, wv. 1.; (attack, beset, fall upon) dis-driusan, sv. II.

(near: adj.) nehwa +dat.; "beside the sea" withra marein, faur marein; "beside the path/road, by the wayside" faur wig; (near: adv.) nehw; (neighbouring, surrounding) bi-sitands, bi-sunjane; "be beside, around" bi-sitan, sv. V.; "on one's left/right side" af hleidumein/taihswon ferai; (FIG.) "be beside oneself" (with amazement) af-slauthnan, wv. 4., us-geisnan, wv. 4., (with fear/anger) agisa/moda dis-habaiths wisan, irreg.; (angry) modags, thwairhs, •grams, •grimms; Mk 16:8 "they were beside themselves with trembling and amazement" diz-uh-than-sat ijos reiro jah us-filmei (=dis-sitan, sv. V).
(and, also) jah; "X and Y and Z besides / and even Z" ...jah...jah...nauhuth-than...
(surround) bi-satjan, wv. 1.; (attack, storm, seize by force - also seize figuratively of emotion/fear, etc.) dis-sitan, sv. V.

batists; (greatest, foremost, best/worst) frumists; (select, choice) ga-waliths; "six choice sheep, six of the best sheep" lamba ga-walida saihs; "go and keep watch as best you can / as best you know how" gaggith witaiduh swaswe kunnuth.
(act treacherously towards) lewjan, fra-lewjan, ga-lewjan, wv. 1.; (reveal, give away) bandwjan, wv. 1. - "your accent betrays you" razda theina bandweith thuk.
(betrothe) ga-wadjon, wv. 2.; "espoused to a man" in fragiftim abin.

(adv.) *bats/*batis, batizo, *ius; (adj.) batiza; "it is better for you" batizo ist thus; (superior) iusiza; (of more worth) mais wulthriza; (rate as better than) rahnjan faura +dat.; "be better" *bats/*batis haban, wv. 3.; "get better" ga-hailnan, wv. 4., ga-nisan, sv. V., waila wairthith (impersonal +dat.) - "they will get better" waila wairthith im.

(amongst, from one to another) mith +dat.; "between/amongst one's selves" mith sis misso; (in between) in midumai, ana midumai, gen.; "lying between the two" ana midumai twaddje ligands; "we've no more than five loaves between us" nist hindar uns maizo fimf hlaibam.

(POSITION: beyond, over, behind, among) hindar +acc. or +dat.; (adv.: beyond) ufar-jaina; (yon side of, over on the other side of, being behind, from behind) hindana gen.; (figurative: beyond, over, apart from) ufar +acc.; (DIRECTION: beyond, over) ufar +acc.; "[going] beyond" *ufar-jaind, *ufar-jaindre; "go beyond, surpass" ufar-theihan, sv. I.; "be superior/above/beyond" ufar-wisan, irreg.; "GO BEYOND WHAT IS RIGHT, overstep the mark, transgress, disobay [a command]" ufar-gaggan, sv. VII. - ufar-iddja, ufar-gaggans.
(v.) (ask) ana-biudan, sv. II. +dat., biudan, sv. II.; "to" ei (+subjunctive); "bid farewell L9,61, greet L8,19" and-qithan, sv. V. +dat.
af-stassais bokos, bokos af-sateinais, sf. pl.
(v.) bindan, bi-bindan, ga-bindan, sv. III.; (with ropes, lower on ropes) in-sailjan, wv. 1.; (bind, join, connect) ga-widan, sv. V.
(birth, place of birth, native land) ga-baurths, sf.; "from birth" us ga-baurthai; "blind from birth, born blind" blinds ga-baurans.

(n.) (PART, SHARE) dails, sf.; (SHARE) hlauts, sm.; (FRAGMENT) ga-bruka, sf.; (SPLINTER, bit of wood) gramst, ?sn.; "a bit, SOMEWHAT, rather" hwa; "a bit, PARTLY, partially" suman, bi sumata, us dailai; "A LITTLE BIT OF" leitil +gen.; "A BIT FUTHER" framis leitil (=Gk. oligon); "a little bit of, not much of" *faus (pl. fawai = "few"); "FOR A BIT, for a while" du hweilai; "I hope to stay with you for a bit/while" wenja mik hwo hweilo saljan at izwis; "for a [little] bit, for a short time" du leitilamma mela, du leitilai hweilai; "after a bit, after a short time" afar ni filu, afar leitil; "FOR QUITE A BIT, for a long time" laggai hweilai, mela lagga; "NOT A BIT, not in the least" ni waihts, ni...waihts, ni waihtai, ni in waihtai, ni und waiht, ni the haldis, ni allis; "they did not undertand a bit if it" eis ni waihtai this frothun.
swarts; "black man, Moor, African" #Maura; "black ink" swartis, swartizl, sn.
(of leaf/tool/weapon) •blath, sn. (gen. •bladis); (sword) *mekeis, hairus, #brands, sm.; (of grass) gras, sn. (gen. grasis).
(v.) id-weitjan, wv. 1. +dat.; (blame, reproach, threaten, accuse) and-beitan, sv. I. +acc.; (find fault with) faian, wv. 3.
un-wahs, un-aiwisks, us-fairina (w.adj.), un-ga-fairinoths; (blameless of motive, pure-hearted) hrainja-hairts; (pure, innocent) hrains (i-stem), hlutrs, swikns.
(bland to taste; deaf & dumb) bauths (gen. baudis).
(v.) (blare out, screech, sound like trumpet) *thiutan, sv. II.
(n.) runs blothis (runs = 'issue, course, flow, rush', sm. (i-stem, gen. runsis)).
(v.) (sully, befoul) bi-sauljan, wv. 1.; (become blemished/sullied) bi-saulnan, wv. 4.
(bless, praise, do good) thiuthjan, wv. 1., ga-thiuthjan, wv. 1.
(fortunate) audags, auda-hafts; (holy) thiutheigs; "to consider blessed/fortunate" audagjan, wv. 1.
(n.) thiuthi-qiss, waila-qiss, sf.; (good fortune, wellness) *awi, sn.; (grace, favour) ansts, sf.
(adj.) blinds; "blind man" blinda, wm.; "half-blind, one-eyed" haihs; "become blind" af-blindnan, wv. 4.
(n.) (flash, blink) brahw, sn.; "in the blink of an eye" in brahwa augins.
(happiness, cheer) hlasei, wf.; (joy) faheths, sf. (gen. fahedais); (rejoicing, exaltation) swegnitha, swignitha, sf.
(happy) hlas (gen. hlasis), wunands, #fraus (gen. #frawis), *gails, #glaths (gen. gladis); (fortunate, happy, blessed) audags, auda-hafts.

(happy) hlas (gen. hlasis), wunands, #fraus (gen. #frawis), *gails, #glaths (gen. gladis); (careless, reckless, casual) *leiht-moths (gen. *leiht-modis); (unconcerned, negligent) un-karja, w.adj.; (lazy, careless) lats.
(v.) (dam, block up) faur-dammjan, wv. 1.; (forbid, prevent) warjan, wv. 1.; (thwart, restrict) ga-aggwjan, wv. 1.; (impede) ana-latjan, wv. 1.; (obstruct, irritate) marzjan, wv. 1.
bloth, sn. (gen. blothis); "flow of blood" runs blothis (runs = 'issue, course, flow, rush', sm. (i-stem, gen. runsis)).
(n.) (hit) slahs, sm. (i-stem)., (wound, blow) banja, sf.; (slap) slahs lofin.
(v.) (of wind) waian, sv. VII. - waiwo, waians; (blow/puff) *blesan, sv. VII. - *blaibles, *blesans; "blow/puff up, exaggerate" uf-blesan, sv. VII.

(v.) (boast, pride oneself) hwopan, sv. VII. - hwaihwop, hwopans; "about" dat., in +dat., bi +dat.; (boast) *bi-haitan, sv. VII, *gainon, wv. 2., flautjan, wv. 1. - "boast about oneself" flautjan sik, wv. 1.
skip, sn.; "go by boat' farjan, wv. 1.
#gardiggs, sm. (The royal bodyguards of the Vandal kings were so called.)
(marsh, lake) saiws, sm. (i-stem); (mire, muck) *sauljo, wf.; (mud) fani, sn.
(brave) *balths, #koneis; (fearless) un-agands; (keen) #funs (gen. #funsis); "be bold, dare" ana-nanthjan, wv. 1.; "make bold, embolden" balthjan, wv. 1.
fra-itan, sv, V. (Past: fret, fretum, fritans).

(FETTER) bandi, ga-binda, ga-bundi, kuna-wida, naudi-bandi, sf.; (of iron) eisarna-bandi, sf.; (on feet) ana fotum eisarna, eisarna bi fotuns gabugana; (CONNECTION, link, ligament, join) ga-wiss, sf.; (CONTRACT, warrenty, security, credit contract) kautsjo, wf.
(prison) karkara, sf. - "in bondage/prison" in karkarai; (slavery, servitude) thiadw, sn.; (servitude, service, worship) skalkinassus, sm.
(n.) marka, sf.; (edge) •randa, sf.; "neighbour across border" ga-marko, wf.
ga-baurans; "to be born" ga-baurans wairthan, sv. III.; "born blind" blinds ga-baurans; "born of the earth" airtha-kunds; "only-born son" aina-baur, sm. (i-stem).
barms, sm. (i-stem); (breast) brusts, f. (Declined like baurgs); (innards, fig: 'heart') hairthra, sn.pl.

(n.) (LORD) frauja, wm.; (RULER, MANAGER) *waldands, m.; (OF HOUSEHOLD) garda-waldands, sm., heiwa-frauja, wm.; (in compounds, MASTER) -faths, sm. (i-stem, gen. -fadis) - "boss of a hundred men, centurion" hunda-faths, thusundi-faths; "...of a thousand, chiliarch" thusundi-faths; "ruler of synagogue" synagoga-faths (i-stem, gen. -fadis); (RULER) reiks, fraujinonds, m., faura-mathleis, faur-stasseis, sm.; (GOVERNOR) kindins, sm.; (COUNCELLOR, GOVERNOR) ragineis, sm.; (KING) thiudans, (EMPEROR) kaisar, sm.
bai, bajoths (acc. bans, dat. baim, nom. acc. neut. ba), ain-hwatharuh.

(v.) (TRANS. irritate, weary) us-agljan, wv. 1.; (make trouble for, threaten) us-thriutan, sv. II. +dat.; (bother, force s-one to go out of their way) draibjan, wv. 1.; (trouble, frustrate) ga-aggwjan, wv. 1.; (torment) balwjan, wv. 1. +dat.; (disturb, upset) drobjan, wv. 1.; (INTR. be bothered) ga-drobnan, wv. 4.; (worry, be anxious) maurnan, wv. 3., and-sitan; (be sad, troubled) saurgan, wv. 3.; (be concerned) karon, wv. 2., sik kara wisan, irreg. +gen. of thing that bothers - "aren't you bothered by the fact that we're going to die?" niu kara ist thuk thizei fraqistnam?; "don't let that bother you, never mind" ni karos (2.sg.).
(base) *grundus, sm.; (basis, foundation, essence, sense of confidence) stoma, wm.; "to the bottom" und dalath.
(adj.) (bound physically/figuratively, attached, joined, captive, married) hafts; (tied, attached) ga-widans; (tied) bundans; (tied with rope) in-sailiths.
(constraint) ga-aggwei, wf.; "the bounds of the law" witodis ga-aggwei.
(shelter, shade, covered walkway, booth, hut) •laubjo, wf. (cf. MnE lobby, NHG Laube, It loggia, Late L laubia/lobium).
(v.) (slap) kaupatjan, wv. 1. - - kaupasta, kaupatiths; (break, quarrel, fight, take part in competion-fight) brikan, sv. IV.; (fight, squabble, box/wrestle) jiukan, wv. 3.
magus, sm., magula, wm.; (child) barn, sn. barnilo, wn.; (son, child, baby) baur, sm. (i-stem); (youth) jugga-lauths, sm. (i-stem, gen. -laudis).
(v.) hwopan, sv. VII. "about" dat., in +dat., bi +dat.; *bi-haitan, sv. VII, *gainon, wv. 2., flautjan, wv. 1. - "brag about oneself" flautjan sik, wv. 1.
(bold) *balths, #koneis; (fearless) un-agands; (keen) #funs (gen. #funsis); "dare, be brave" ana-nanthjan, wv. 1.; "make brave, embolden" balthjan, wv. 1.
(bold, brash) *us-balths; "to brazen out, be insolent" *us-balthjan, wv. 1.
(loaf, bread) hlaifs, sm.; (loaves, bread) hlaibans, sm.pl.; (unleavened) azymus, sm.

(v.) magan, pp. - mag, magum, mahta.; "could he be the Christ?" niu aufto sa wesi Xristus?; "go and keep watch as best you can / as best you know how" gaggith witaiduh swaswe kunnuth; (passive: CAN BE, ABLE TO BE) mahts +inf. "how can a grown man to be born?" hwaiwa mahts ist manna altheis wisands gabairan?; THOUGH ONLY THE PASSIVE CONSTRUCTION IS ATTESTED, ANALOGY WITH skuld ist MIGHT IMPLY AN UNDECLINED NEUTER ACTIVE "can, able to, possible for one to" maht ist +inf +dat. for person able - or maybe this function was fulfilled adequately with the simple verb.

•addjis,  sn. (Crim. 'ada'. This, anyway, is the reconstruction favoured by the OED, 'egg'  being an old s-stem according to Campbell - cf. the OE plural aegru. On the other  hand, Priebsch & Collinson suggest *addja, while Braune & Helm and Koebler all  have *addi, even though B&H §115a. says that the s-stems were all transferred  to the a-declension (e.g. agis), in which case the OED would be right. See also:  *sals, *salis 'hall').

-u-  (The particle -u- indicates a question; attached to first word in phrase, especially  a verb - "is it permitted?" skuldu ist? If the verb has a prefix, the -u- comes  right after the prefix: "do the two of you believe?" ga-u-laubjats?); (Other question  particle, used at start of phrase) an, an-uh; (NOTE: These particles not required  if other more specific ones are used, thus) "why trouble the teacher any longer?"  hwa thanamais draibeis thana laisari?; "surely one can't go back in the womb?"  ibai mag in wamba aftra galeithan?

(FOR, for the sake of,  before, ago, owing to, regarding, as for) faur +acc. - "offering himself FOR US"  gasaljands sik faur uns; "I suffer for you" winna faur izwis; "for your souls"  faur saiwalos izwaros; (FOR THE PURPOSE OF) du +dat. - "for manure" du maihstau;  "for begging, burials, etc." du +inf.: du aihtron, du filhan, etc.; (BECAUSE OF)  in +gen.; "FOR THIS REASON" in this, du-the, duth-the; "WHAT FOR?" du-hwe?, du  hwamma?, in hwis?; (REGARDING, in respect of) ana +dat. - "God's purpose for themselves"  runa gudis ana sik; "it is EASIER FOR a cammel...than for" rathizo ist allis ulbandau...thau  +dat.; "for, since, as, you see, BECAUSE" allis, auk, raihtis (Each of these three  come as 2nd element in clause, with auk taking precidence over the others when  they appear with other meanings); "PRAY FOR" bidjan bi sv. V. (+acc.); (BUY/EXCHANGE  FOR) und +dat.; "aren't two sparrows bought for a penny?" niu twai sparwans assarjau  bugjanda?; "that they might buy food for themselves" ei bugjaina sis matins; "SELL  FOR" frabugjan in +acc.; "FOR HOW LONG?" hwan lagg mel?, und hwa?; "we will PREPARE  LODGINGS FOR him" salithwos at imma taujos; "FOR EVER" du aiwins; "for neither,  for not" nih allis; "stayed FOR TWO DAYS" salida twans dagans; "FOR A WHILE" und  mel; "FOR ONE MILE" rasta aina; "FOR A DAY'S JOURNEY" dagis wig; "we should DO  GOOD FOR/TOWARDS everyone" waurkjam thiuth withra allans; "TAKE FOR ONESELF" at  sis niman, sv. IV.; "he WAITS FOR A single COMMAND FOR each action" at allamma  waurstwe ainaizos anabusnais beidith; (HEAD FOR/TOWARDS) "aiming for the target,  I head for the prize" bi mundrein afargagga afar sigislauna; "POSSIBLE FOR [s-one]"  mahteig fram +dat.; "FOR [IT TO BE POSSIBLE THAT], IN ORDER THAT" thei +subj.  - "[even] with a hundred pennies, there aren't enough loaves for everyone to have  a little" twaim hundam skatte hlaibos ni ganohai sind thei nimai hwarjuzuh leitil;  "CASTING LOTS FOR them" wairpandans hlauta ana thos (hlauta = m.dat.sg.); "FOR  ALL THIS" ana tho alla; "I beg/adjure you FOR GOD'S SAKE" biswara thuk bi guda.

(question, have scruples) and-hruskan, wv. 3.; (raise a question) ga-wagjan sokein, sf., wv. 1.; (dispute) sakan, sv. VI. - "they queried whether he was in fact a Pharisee" sokun thatei sa raihtis Fareisaius was; (ask) fraihnan, sv. V. (gen. of thing, acc. of person asked).

ASKING QUESTIONS: -u-...? (The particle -u- indicates a question, in direct or indirect speech; attached to first word in phrase, especially a verb - "is it permitted?" skuldu ist?  If the verb has a prefix, the -u- comes right after the prefix: "do the two of you believe?" ga-u-laubjats?; "him or his parents?" sa-u thau fadrein is?); (Another question particle, used at start of phrase) "so...?, then...?" an, an-uh; "what then" an hwa...?; (NOTE: These particles not required in the main clause if other more specific ones are used, thus) "why are you so afraid?" duhwe faurhtai sijuth swa?; (RHETORICAL) "surely one can't go back in the womb?" ibai mag in wamba aftra galeithan?; "for would he not seem then..." nei auk thuhtedi thau...; "Am I a Jew?" waitei ik iudaius im? (Said by Pilot).

(CORRECT, STRAIGHT) raihts; (TRUE) sunjis, sunjeins; (JUST, right, fair, RIGHTEOUS) us-waurhts, ga-raihts; (WELL, correct, rightly) waila; "were we not right to say that...?" niu waila qitham weis thatei...?; (APPROPRIATE) ga-dofs (i-stem, gen. ga-dobis); (PROPERLY, advisedly) ga-redaba; (decent) *ga-fehs; (properly, respectably) ga-fehaba; (appropriately) ga-temiba, ga-tilaba; "PUT RIGHT, correct" ga-raihtjan, wv. 1.; (RIGHT/LAWFUL TO DO) "it is right to" skuld ist (+inf.); "it is not right/lawful" ni skuld ist" (+inf.).

(OPPOSITE OF LEFT) taihswa, w.adj.; "RIGHT HAND, the right" taihswo, wf.; "if anyone hits you on the right cheek" jabai hwas thuk stautai bi taiwswon theina kinnu; "he chopped off his right ear" afsloh imma auso thata taihswo; "on [the/his/her/my. etc.] left side" af hleidumein/taihswon ferai; "standing to the right of the altar" standands af taihswon hunslastadis; "he sat at God's right hand" af taihswon gudis.

(CORRECTLY, properly) raihtaba; (correctly, justly) ga-raihtaba; (WELL, excellently, kindly) waila; (RESPECTABLY) ga-fehaba; (commendably, properly) ga-redaba; (APPROPRIATELY) ga-temiba, ga-tilaba; (suitably, worthily) wairthaba; (ACTUALLY, in fact, namely) raihtis; (TRULY) sunjaba.
(hard) hardus; (harsh, strict) *hwass; (narrow) aggwus; "go rigid" ga-staurknan, wv. 4.
(harshly, severely) harduba, hardaba; (strictly, harshly, sharply) hwassaba.
figgra-gulth, sn, •hriggs, sm. (Crim. rinck/ringo; Church Slav. useregz 'earring').
(v.) tahjan, wv. 1., *tairan, wv. 4.; (tear up/apart/to pieces) dis-skreitan, sv. I, dis-tairan, ga-tairan, sv. IV.

(v.) reisan, ur-reisan, sv. I.; (mount, climb) steigan, sv. I.; (rise, go forth/out from, spring up) ur-rinnan, sv. III.; (quickly, shoot upwards) us-hlaupan, sv. VII.; (stand up, rise, come out/from) us-standan, sv. VI.
(n.) (rising up, resurrection) ur-rists, us-stass, sf.; (sunrise, the east, drain/sewer/toilet) ur-runs, sm. (i-stem, gen. ur-runsis).

ahwa, sf.; •baks, m. (i-stem); (stream) rinno, sf.; "the [River] Jordan" Iaurdane ahwa (No definite article, unlike Greek or English - but any qualifying adjective would probably be definite, cf. fairguni alewjo 'Mount of Olives').

gagg, sn., staiga, sf., wigs, sm.; "on/onto the road" ana wiga; (footprint, tracks, trail, step) laists, sm., (i-stem); (ROUGH TRACK) us-drusts, sf.; "on the way" in wiga; "go on one's way" usgaggan in wig; (TRAIL, path, footprint, tracks, step, ?objective/intention) laists, sm. (i-stem); (a rough track) us-drusts, sf.; (STREET) gatwo, wf., *platja, ga-runs, sf. (gen. ga-runsais), faura-dauri, sn.
bi-raubon, wv. 2. (acc. of victim; thing stolen not attested, but ?gen. as in OHG), wilwan, dis-wilwan, sv. III.; (deprive) ga-tarnjan, wv. 1.

(v.) (TRANS.) (move, shake, wag) wagjan, wv. 1.; (shake, perturb) af-swaggwjan, wv. 1.; (shake, stir) ga-wagjan, wv. 1.; (INTR.) (tremble, shake) reiran, wv. 3.; (begin to shake) in-reiran, wv. 3.; (make tremble) af-swaggwjan, wv. 1.
hrugga, sf., wandus, sm., triu, sn., •roda, sf.

(TRANS.) walwjan, wv. 1.; "roll away" af-walwjan, wv. 1.; "roll to" at-walwjan, wv. 1.; "cover by rolling s-thing in front of" faur-walwjan, wv. 1. +dat. for thing rolled & acc. for thing covered (the other walwjan verbs have acc. for thing rolled + dative for any beneficiary); (roll, roll over, capsise) *wiltan, sv. III.; (INTR.) (rock, turn over, capsise) waltjan, wv. 1.; (roll, tumble) *wiltan, sv. III.; "roll around on the floor" walwison, wv. 2.
(room, space) rums, sm.; "there wasn't any room for them" ni was im rumis; (chamber) hethjo, wf.; (upper room) kelikn, sn.; (lodgings, mansion, dwelling) salithwos, sf.pl.
*sail, sn., *wida, sf.; (fetter, rope for tying prisoner) kuna-wida, sf.
(n.) "rot, ruin, corruption, transience" riurei, wf.; "mould" •mudw, sn.
(v.) (INTR.) fra-wairthan, sv. III.; "to go mouldy" •mugan, wv. 3.; (TRANS. "ruin, spoil") fra-wardjan, wv. 1.; riurjan, wv. 1.
(perishable, rotten, spoilt) riureis; "mouldy" •mudweins; "go rotten, become corrupt/spoilt" riureis wairthan, sv. III.
*un-sutis; (unkind) un-mildeis; (violent) slahals; (ferociously violent) un-mana-riggws; "rough situation" un-suti, sn.; (uncertain) un-wiss.
(PREP: around, round, near) bi +acc.; "around, surrounding, round about" bi-sunjane; "round about, approximately" swe; "round his waist/loins" bi hup seinana.

(WAKE UP someone) us-wakjan, wv. 1.; (wake, raise) ur-raisjan, wv. 1.; (bring round) us-skaujan, wv. 1.; (be roused from sleep) ga-waknan, wv. 4.; (come to, regain consciousness) us-skaujan sik. (also with passive: "to recover oneself"); (TO STIR UP EMOTION) (anger, provoke) gramjan, in-gramjan, wv. 1.; (stir up, excite - e.g. a crowd) us-wagjan, wv. 1.; (agitate, stir up, disturb) drobjan, wv. 1.; (move inwardly, stir, arouse passion/emotion) in-wagjan, wv. 1.; "be roused to emotion/pity" in-wagjan sik, in-rauhtjan, wv. 1.; (be roused to compassion) in-feinan, wv. 4.

bnauan, sv. VII.? (as originally), or wv. III. (like bauan & trauan); (wipe) swairban, sv. III.; "rub out" af-swairban, sv. III.; (smear) bi-smeitan, ga-smeitan, sv. I. (dat. of pers. smeared, acc. of body part smeared & substance), BUT: "he smeared mud in his eyes" gasmait ana imma thata fani.
(excrement, rubbish) smarnos, sf.pl.; (reject, abortion) us-waurpa, sf.

(n.) (annihilation, doom) qisteins, sf.; (tearing down, demolition, destruction in general) ga-taurths, sf.; (wastage, spoiling) *fra-qisteins, sf.; (dispersal, scattering, shredding, diaspora) dis-taheins, sf.; (end of existence) dis-wiss, sf.; (dissolution, end, melting away) ga-malteins, sf. (corrupting, degeneration) fra-wardeins, sf.; (corrosion, disintegration, transience, rot) riurei, wf.
(v.) (spoil) fra-wardjan, riurjan, wv. 1.; (demolish, destroy) ga-tairan, wv. 4.; (destroy) qistjan, fra-qistjan, us-qistjan, wv. 1. +dat. or +acc.
(n.) (reign, power, empire) reiki, sn.; "by the rules" witodeigo.
(v.) fraujinon +dat., ga-fraujinon +dat., raginon +dat., reikinon, wv. 2. +dat., waldan +dat., ga-waldan, sv. VII. +dat., faura-standan, sv. V.; thiudanon, wv. 2. - "over" ufar +dat.

reiks, fraujinonds, m., faura-mathleis, faur-stasseis, sm.; (GOVERNOR) kindins, sm.; (COUNCELLOR, GOVERNOR) ragineis, sm.; (KING) thiudans, (EMPEROR) kaisar, sm.; (LORD, MASTER) frauja; (MASTER) *waldands, (in compounds: MASTER) -faths, sm. (i-stem, gen. -fadis); synagoga-faths, sm. (i-stem, gen. fadis).
(n.) (course, flow, issue of fluid) runs, sm. (i-stem, gen. runsis).

(v.) rinnan, sv. III., thragjan, wv. 1.; "run up to" du-rinnan, du-at-rinnan, sv. III.; "run on ahead" bi-thragjan faur, wv. 1.; "run together" ga-rinnan, sv. III.; "run away" af-thliuhan, sv. II.; "run about" bi-rinnan, sv. III.
(rune, secret, mystery) runa, sf.; (runic character, rune-stave) *runa-stafs, sm. (i-stem, gen. *runa-stabis).
(n.) (course, rush, flow, issue of fluid) runs, sm. (i-stem, gen. runsis).
(n.) (reed) raus, sn. (gen. rausis); (sudden move, course, flow, issue of fluid) runs, sm. (i-stem, gen. runsis).

(v.) sniwan, sv. V., sniumjan, ga-sniumjan, wv. 1., •hrapon, wv. 2.; "but God's wrath will rush upon them" aththan snauh ana ins hatis gudis; (run, hasten) rinnan, sv. III.; (rush/hasten towards) du-at-sniwan, sv. V.; "to rush violently" run ga-waurkjan sis - ga-waurhta, ga-waurhts; (rush past, rush on ahead, precede) faur-bi-sniwan, sv. V.; "rush on ahead of, precede" bi-sniwan faur, sv. V. +acc.
sabbato (indeclinable); sabbatus (pl. fluctuates between i- & u- declensions).
(n.) hunsl, tibr, sn., ala-brunsts, sf, sauths, sm. (i-stem, gen. saudis).

(sad, sullen) gaurs; (woeful, wretched, sad, pathetic) wainahs; (unhappy, discontented) un-wunands; "to be(come) sad" ga-hnipnan, wv. 4.; (mourn) gaunon, wv. 2.; (weep) gretan, sv. VII.; (weep and mourn) hiufan, sv. II., qainon, wv. 2.; (sorrow) saurgan, wv. 3.; (be upset/agitated) ga-drobnan, wv. 4.; (become upset) in-drobnan, wv, IV.
gauritha, saurga, sf., gaunothus, sm., gaurei, wf.; (pain, grief) sair, sn.; (sadness, regret) trigo, wf.
*ga-freideins, sf.; (take into safekeeping, keep safe) *ga-freisjan, wv. 1.
froths (gen. frodis), snutrs, weis; (wise, clever) handugs; (wise, sober) in-ahs.
frodei, snutrei, handugei, wf.; (reason, discresion) ga-frathjei, wf.

"for the sake of" (on behalf of) fram +dat.; (on account of) bi +dat., in +gen., du lewa +gen. - "for the sake of the flesh" du lewa leikis; "pray for the sake of" bidjan bi, sv. V. +acc.; "I beg you, for God's sake" biswara thuk bi guda.
(pay, reward) laun, sn.; (worker's pay) *asno, wf.; (soldier's pay) anno, wf.
(greet) goljan, wv. 1.; (reverence, worship, greet) in-weitan, sv. I. +acc.
(saving, healing) ga-nists, naseins, sf.; (redemption) faur-bauhts, us-luneins, sf.

sama (pr. & w.adj.); "the same" thata samo; "one and the same" ain jah thata samo; "the same (things) tho samona; (identical) ibna-leiks, sama-leiks; "in the same way" ana-leiko, ga-leiko, sama-leiko; "the same size" sama-lauths (gen. -laudis); "of the same mind" aina-munds, sama-frathjis, sama-saiwals; "at the same time" bijands; "and at the same time" bijandz-uth-than.
"to be quite sane" fulla-frathjan, sv. VI.; "be sane/reasonable" waila frathjan, sv. VI.
(ridicule) bi-hlahjan, sv. VI, bi-laikan, sv. VII., bi-mampjan, •skairnjan, wv. 1.; (heckle) •hakiljan, wv. 1.
soth, sn.; (sufficiency, contentment) ga-nauha, wm.; (enjoyment) *ga-wizns, sf.

(satisfy, fill) ga-sothjan, wv. 1. (gen. or dat. of thing that satisfies +acc. of person satisfied); (meet requirements) ga-nohjan, wv. 1.; (serve well, please) fulla-fahjan, wv. 1.; (suffice) ga-nauhan, pp. - ga-nah, ga-nauhum, ga-nauhta.
•sambatodags; "sabbath" sabbato dags (indeclinable); sabbatus dags (pl. fluctuates between i- & u- declensions).

(v.) (save) nasjan, wv. 1.; (save, heal) ga-nasjan, wv. 1.; (save, protect, preserve, shelter) bairgan, sv. III. +dat.; "both are saved, both survive" bajothum bairgada (impersonal passive, cf. ON e-m er borgit); "be saved, be healed, attain salvation" ga-nisan, sv. V.
(v.) (taste) at-snarpjan, wv. 1.; (taste, test) kausjan, wv. 1. (+gen. = "taste", +acc. = "test, etc.").

(v.) qithan, sv. V.; "to" +dat., or du +dat.; "they say there is no resurrection" qithand usstass ni wisan; "say grace, offer thanks" awiliudon, wv. 2.; "say, for instance, namely" raihtis; "as I said before" swe ju faura-qath.
thlahsjan, ogjan, us-agjan; (scare off) af-agjan, wv. 1.; (scare out of one's wits) us-gaisjan, wv. 1.
faurhts, *agands, *us-agiths; "to be scared" ga-thlahsnan, wv. 4.; "to be scared out of one's wits" us-geisnan, wv. 4.
ogjands, agjands, thlahsjands, us-gaisjands; (fierce, fearsome) *in-grimjis; (unholy, unfriendly, sinister, demonic) *un-hulths.

(disperse, shred, scatter) dis-tahjan, wv. 1.; (scatter like chaff, "scatter to the four winds") dis-winthjan, wv. 1.; (strew) straujan +dat., ga-straujan (*dat.), uf-straujan, wv. 1. +dat.; (scatter over, sprinkle, strew) ufar-trusnjan, wv. 1. (dat. of thing thrown).
missa-qiss, sf.; "schisms, factions, heresy" hairaiseis, sf.pl.

(v.) ana-haitan, sv. VII +dat., ga-sakan, sv. VI. +dat. or +acc.; (rebuke, argue with) sakan; (threaten, accuse) hwotjan, ga-hwotjan, wv. 1.; (reproach, blame) id-weitjan, wv. 1. +dat.; (blame, reproach, threaten, accuse) and-beitan, sv. I. +acc.

(mock) bi-hlahjan, sv. VI, bi-laikan, sv. VII., bi-mampjan, wv. 1.; (insult) lauan, sv. VII. +dat., ga-naitjan, wv. 1.; (scorn, despise, reject) fra-kunnan, pp. - fra-kann, fra-kunnum, fra-kuntha +dat., or: at +dat.; (rebuff) uf-brikan, sv. IV. +dat.; "spit at, despise, reject" and-speiwan, sv. I.
(n.) (excrement, rubbish) smarnos, sf.pl.; "scrap of cloth, rag" fana, sm., •fata, sf., •laska, sf., plats, sm.; (fight) dispute, fight, prize-fight) jiuka, sf.
"scrape out" us-graban, sv. VI.; "scrape together, heap/hoard up" rikan, sv. V.
(n.) (strife, fighting, violence) haifsts, sf.; (struggle, strife) brakja, sf., sakjo, waihjo, wf.
(v.) •kratton, wv. 2., •razzjan, wv. 1., •raspon, wv. 2.; (incise, score, write) *wreitan, sv. I.
(n.) (shout) drunjus, sm.; (blare, screech, trumpet blast) *thuts, sm. (i-stem); (screaming, shouting, outcry) hrops, sm.
(v.) (shout, scream, cry out) hropjan, uf-hropjan, wopjan, at-wopjan, uf-wopjan, wv. 1., auhjon, wv. 2.; (blare, screech, make trumpet noise) *thiutan, sv. II.; (screech, shriek) •kreitan, sv. I.
(v.) kreitan, sv. I.; (screech like owl, blare like trumpet) thiutan, sv. II.
mela, ga-meleins, sf., thata gamelido, wn., bokos (pl. of boka, sf., 'letter of alphabet'), mela, (pl. of 'mel', sn.)
marei, wf., mari-saiws, sm. (i-stem); "on/along the seashore" faur marein, withra marein ana statha.
(v.) (seek, look for, try to) sokjan, ga-sokjan, wv. 1.
(shore, bank, landing place) staths (gen. stathis); "on the seashore" faur marein, withra marein ana statha.
(n.) (Modern sense: period of the year) athn, sn.; (Biblical sense: a particular time, the right time/season) mel, sn.
(on time, opportunely, at the right time) uhteiho.
(seat, perch, nest) sitls, sm.; (chair, throne) stols, sm.
(adj.) (hidden) ana-laugns (i-stem), fulgins; (secret, occult) •darneis; (stealthy) *thiubjis; "make secret, conceal" •darnjan, wv. 1.
(part) dails, sf.; (fragment) ga-bruka, sf.; (section of land, area) gawi, sn., fera, sf.
(region) gawi, sn., fera, sf.; (part, share, fragment) dails, sf.; (share) hlauts, sm.
(v.) (make firm, safe & secure) thwastjan, wv. 1.; (stabilise, fortify, fix) tulgjan, wv. 1.; (get hold of, keep, seize) ga-haban, wv. 3.
(safety, firmness) thwastitha, sf.; (bond, warrenty, credit contract) kautsjo, wf.
(incite, entice, persuade) ga-hwatjan, wv. 1.; (lead astray) uf-airzjan, wv. 1.

(see, look at, observe, regard) saihwan, ga-saihwan, sv. III.; "saw clearly" sahw bairhtaba; "to see naked, etc." saihwan naqadana +acc.; (look right at) in-saihwan; "seeing Peter warming himself, she looked straight at him and said" gasaihwandei Paitru warmjandan sik, insaihwandei du imma qath; (look at, look around at) bi-saihwan, sv. V.; (look at, heed) at-saihwan; (see through, look in [mirror]) thairh-saihwan, sv.V.; (perceive) gaumjan, wv. 1. +dat., ga-saihwan, sv. V.; (look up; start to see after being blind) us-saihwan, sv. V.; "see!, behold!" sai!; "seeing as, given that..." thande.
fraiw, sn. (collective sg.) - "sow seed" fraiwa saian (=dat., cf. ON); (figurative) *seths, sf. (gen. sedais) in compound mana-seths 'mankind, people'.
sokjan, wv. 1.; (ask, seek, enquire, find out, learn by enquiry) ga-fraihnan, sv. V. (gen. of thing, acc. of person asked).
thugkjan wv. 1. (thuhta, thuhts) - "it seems to me" thugkeith mis.
(boil, seethe, bubble over with enthusiasm) wulan, sv. IV.; (seethe with passion, burn up inside) in-tundnan, wv. 4.

(PHYSICALLY) fahan, ga-fahan, sv. VII, greipan, fair-greipan, sv. I.; (imprison) fra-hinthan, us-hinthan, sv. III.; (take, have, hold) haban, ga-haban wv. 3.; (trap, net, catch out) ga-niutan, sv. II.; (seize, plunder) wilwan, sv. III.; (EMOTIONALLY) dis-sitan, sv. V., dis-haban, wv. 3.; "they were seized by a great fear" agisa mikilamma habaida wesun; (FEVER, DEMONIC POSSESSION, etc.) ana-haban, wv. 3.
(choose) ga-waljan, wv. 1.; (pick out, test, prove) us-kiusan, sv. II. +acc.

silba, wm., silbo, wf./wn.; "I myself" ik silba/silbo; (yourself) thu silba; "yourself, of your own accord" af thus silbin; (THE SELF, soul, inner being, individual life, earthly existence) saiwala, sf.; "look out only for oneself, act selfishly" sein ain sokjan, wv. 1.; "seek glory for one's self" hauhitha seina sokjan, wv. 1.

*ga-hobains, sf.; (calm, dignity, equanimity, self-possession) ana-wiljei, wf.; "having self-control, calm/dignified" ana-wiljis; "lack of self-control" un-ga-hobains, sf.; "lacking self-control" un-ga-habands sik, wv. 3.
"act selfishly, be only interested in oneself, seek gain only for oneself" sein ain sokjan, wv. 1.

kaupon, wv. 2.; fra-bugjan, wv. 1 (+acc. of commodity) - fra-bauhta, fra-bauhts; "for" in (+acc. of amount); "because it would be possible to sell it for more than three hundred pennies" maht wesi auk frabugjan in manazizo thau thija hunda skatte.
(likeness) ga-leiki, sn.; (thought, seeming, conscience) thuhtus, sm.
sandjan, sv. I.; "send forth/out/off" in-sandjan, us-sandjan, wv. 1.; "send/drive away" us-dreiban, sv. I. +dat. or +acc.
*siniza; "senior servant" •sini-skalks, sm.; "most senior, eldest, an elder" sinista.

(n.) (good sense, reasonableness) ga-frathjei, wf.; (sobriety, self-possession) in-ahei, wf.; (good sense, understanding) *witi, sn.; (wisdom) frodei, snutrei, handugei, wf.; "have some sense, be reasonable" waila frathjan, sv. VI.; "sense of hearing" hliuma, wm.; "sense of sight" siuns, sf.; "sense of smell, a smell" dauns, sf.

(v.) (perceive) gaumjan, wv. 1. +dat.; (understand) frathjan, sv. VI. +dat.; (BECOME AWARE OF, know) uf-kunnan, irreg. (present as wv. 3., pret. almost always strong: uf-kuntha, but one example each of weak pret. and past part.: uf-kunnaida, uf-kunnaidai).
(reasonable) *ga-frathjis; (thoughtful, consciencious) anda-thahts; (alert, mindful, sober) in-ahs; (alert, sober) un-skaus; "be sensible/reasonable" waila frathjan, sv. VI.

(TRANS., INTR., separate, divide, depart) skaidan, sv. VII. +dat. or +acc. - "let no man separate it" manna thamma ni skaidai; "let not the wife separate from her husband" qenai fairra abin ni skaidan; "to split/divide a man from/against his father" skaidan mannan withra attan; (depart) skaidan sik, sv. VII.; (INTR.) "part, separate" ga-skaidnan, wv. 4.; (divorce) af-satjan, wv. 1.; (isolate) ga-ainan, wv. 3.; (INTR.) ga-skaidnan, wv. 4.
(distinction, difference) ga-skaideins, sf.; (divorce) af-sateins, af-stass, sf.
(tomb, grave) ?aurahi, sf. (or ?aurahjo, wf.), *nawistr, sn., hlaiw, sn. (sg. only), hlaiwasna, sf. (pl. only).
tewa, sf.; "in sequence, in order, connectedly" ga-hahjo; "in their right sequence" in seinai tewai.
tewa, sf.; "in series, in order, connectedly" ga-hahjo; "in their right order" in seinai tewai.

(important, significant, of worth, mattering) wulthrs; (thoughtful, consciencious) anda-thahts; (sober, alert, mindful, sensible) in-ahs; (rational) *ga-frathjis; (alert, sober) un-skaus; (sad) gaurs; (sacred, respectful of sanctity) weihs; (zealous, earnest, persistent) us-dauths (gen. us-daudis).
(zelously, earnestly, with a will) us-daudo; (sensibly) *in-aho, *un-skausaba; (earnestly, sacredly, in a holy/respectful way) weihaba.
(sobriety, self-possession) in-ahei, wf.; (sense, reasonableness) ga-frathjei, wf.; (magnitude, geatness) mikilei, wf.; (sadness) gauritha, sf.
skalks, thius, and-bahts, sm., (hireling/hired-servant) asneis, sm.; (male) thiu-magus, sm.; (female) thiwi, *thiwairna, sf.; "fellow servant" ga-skalki, sn.; (collective) "servants" thewis, sn.

(OF PERSON: act as servant for) skalkinon, wv. 2. +dat.; (serve, serve guests, minister to) and-bahtjan, wv, I. +dat. - "didn't come to be served, but to serve" ni qam at andbahtjam ak andbahtjan (andbahtjam = dat.pl. of andbahti, sn. 'service'); (serve well, please, satisfy) fulla-fahjan, wv. 1.; "SERVE AS SOLDIER" driugan, sv. II., drauhtinon, wv. 2. +dat., militon, wv. 2. (*dat.); (SERVE DRINK to, give to drink) #skagkjan, wv. 1. (?dat. of person, acc. of drink), dragkjan, ga-dragkjan, wv. 1. (acc. of person, dat. of drink); (OF THING: serve a purpose, be useful, be any good) botjan, wv. 1., dugan, pp. - daug, dugum, dauhta; "fighting over words SERVES NO USEFUL PURPOSE" waurdam weihan du ni waihtai daug.

(gen. -duthais); (ALL TIME, AEON) aiws, sm. (GIVE TO) giban +dat.; (SAY TO)  qithan + dat., qithan du +dat.; (MOVEMENT: with verbs meaning "GO", and with ga-qiman  "come together to") du +dat.; (COME) qiman at +dat.; (TOWARDS, AGAINST) withra  +acc. - "went to meet him" withraiddja ina; "JUSTIFY ONESSELF TO" sunjon sik withra  +acc.; "UP TO, TILL" und +acc.; "TO THE END" und andi; "watch up to the end of"  fairweitjan in andi +gen.; (GIVE TO) giban, sv. V. +dat.; (ATTITUDE TOWARDS) "we  should do good to everyone" waurkjam thiuth withra allans; (INFINITIVE: The infinitive  may be used with or without "du" before it, although Gothic often uses "ei" +  subjunctive where English has "to" + infinitive); (TO DO) "it is not good take"  ni goth ist niman; (TRY TO) "they tried to touch him" sokidedun attekan imma;  (AFRAID TO) "they were afraid to ask him" ohtedun fraihnan ina; (WANT TO) "what  do you want me to do for you" hwa wileis ei taujau thus?; "I want you to give  me the head of John" wiljau ei mis gibais haubith Johannes; (IN ORDER TO) "they  came to see" qemun saihwan; (AVAILABLE TO) "they don't have anything to eat" ni  haband hwa matjaina; (WHAT TO) "they didn't know what to say" ni wissa hwa rodidedi;  (LAWFUL TO) skuld wisan +inf. "for [s-one]" +dat.; (BE OF USE TO) botjan, wv.  1. +acc.; (ORDER TO) "he commanded them to tell no-one about him" faurbauth im  ei mannhun ni qetheina bi ina; (AUTHORITY TO) waldufni (+inf); "they FORGOT TO  take bread" ufarmunnodedun niman hlaibans.
himma  daga; "till today, to this day" und hina dag; "from today, henceforth" fram himma  nu.

III., ga-qiman, sv. IV., ga-lisan sik, sv. V., ga-gaggan (sik),  sv. VII. - ga-iddja, ga-gaggans; "together with" mith +dat., mith- (attached as  prefix to verb) - "those crucified with him" thai mith ushramidans imma.
(sign)  taikns, sm., bandwa, sf., bandwo, wf.

(endure  suffering, put up with a person) us-thulan, wv. 3.; (cope with) fra-bairan, sv.  IV.
mota, sf., mota-staths,  sm. (i-stem, gen. mota-stadis).
mota,  sf., mota-staths, sm. (i-stem, gen. mota-stadis).

tuggo,  wn.; (language, dialect) razda; "speak a tongue/language" razdai rodjan, wv. 1.

"turn, turn round" wandjan, wv. 1.; "turn away/aside,  deviate" af-wandjan, us-wandjan, wv. 1.; "turn round/back, return, repent" ga-wandjan,  wv. 1.; "let him not turn back" ni gawandjai sik ibukana; "turn down, decline"  faur-qithan, sv. "turn into, make into" ga-taujan du +dat., wv. 1. - "you have turned it into a  den of criminals" gatawideduth ita du filigrja waidedjane; "turn into [some amount  of money by selling]" fra-bugjan in +acc., wv. 1. twaim  sintham; "once or twice" jah ainamma sintha jah twaim.

VI. +dat.; "they understood nothing of this, they didn't  understand at all" eis ni waihtai this frothun; "they did not understand what  it was he said to them" jainai ni frothun hwa was thatei rodida du im; (KNOW,  be familiar with) *leisan, pp. - lais, *lisum, *lissa; kunnan, pp. - kann, kunnum,  kuntha; (LEARN, grasp, find out) finthan, sv. kilthei,  wf.; (womb, body) qithus, sm.; (belly, womb) wamba, sf.

dals, ?sm. (or dal ?sn. - Neuter  in OE, neuter and masculine in OS & OHG, masculine in ON).
